text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the explanation to cover how the protection of the EU market from non-compliant imports via NI is achieved via the concept of goods 'at risk' of subsequent import into the EU being treated differently from those intended for NI consumption. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this under 'The \"At Risk\" Test', detailing the Green Lane (not at risk/for NI consumption) and Red Lane (at risk/going to EU) system, which is the core mechanism established by the Protocol and amended by the Windsor Framework to manage this distinction. It also correctly identifies the default presumption of risk.", "criterion_id": "180fd671-ce28-4f9a-a704-b66b61a7b661"}
